metadata.Description: A measure of the average cost of generating electricity from a particular source over its lifetime, taking into account the initial investment, operating costs, and expected output.

subelement_relations.Description: Capital costs are a component of the levelized cost of electricity and include the initial investment required for the construction and installation of the energy generation infrastructure.
Operating costs are a component of the levelized cost of electricity and include the expenses associated with the day-to-day operation and maintenance of the energy generation infrastructure.
Fuel costs are a component of the levelized cost of electricity and include the expenses related to the procurement and utilization of fuel for energy generation.
Maintenance costs are a component of the levelized cost of electricity and include the expenses associated with the regular upkeep and repair of the energy generation infrastructure.

Transmission and distribution costs are a component of the levelized cost of electricity and include the expenses related to the transmission and distribution of electricity from the generation source to the end-users.

relations.Description: The levelized cost of electricity is implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to ensure cost-effective energy generation and consumption.
The levelized cost of electricity provides funding for various renewable energy projects to promote sustainable energy generation.
The levelized cost of electricity focuses on implementing cost reduction strategies to make energy generation more affordable and accessible.
The levelized cost of electricity is used in energy market analysis to assess the competitiveness of different energy sources.
The levelized cost of electricity partners with the Electricity Regulatory Authority to ensure fair pricing and regulation in the energy sector.
The levelized cost of electricity contributes to the overall energy transition by promoting the adoption of renewable energy sources.
The levelized cost of electricity monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
The levelized cost of electricity targets affordable energy access for all, especially in underserved communities.
